meanings.definition: A malignant progressive disease in which the bone marrow and other blood-forming organs produce increased numbers of immature or abnormal leukocytes.
meanings.sent1: Leukemia can make you feel very tired and weak.
meanings.sent2: The doctor diagnosed her with leukemia after running some tests.
meanings.sent3: Even though it sounds like a type of pasta, leukemia is a serious illness.
meanings.sent4: In the battle against leukemia, the body's immune system fights tirelessly.
meanings.sent5: The classroom learned about leukemia through a simple and clear presentation.

meanings.definition: A form of cancer characterized by the uncontrolled increase of abnormal white blood cells in the bone marrow.
meanings.sent1: She underwent chemotherapy to treat her leukemia.
meanings.sent2: Leukemia can affect people of all ages.
meanings.sent3: The leukemia cells partied in the bone marrow, causing chaos.
meanings.sent4: The spread of leukemia in her body was like a wildfire out of control.
meanings.sent5: The doctor explained leukemia using a diagram to make it easier to understand.
